Their spider- rolls are surprisingly adequate for their price. I like how they're pre-made, but not yucky. 

I actually go out of my way to eat here!
author: Alexander D.

description: Yeah! We came here so hungry, and when we saw that Olive Garden had a huge line at 8 p.m., we decided to come to the Stonestown Galleria Food Court and found this place. I was staring at the soba noodle display in the case when we noticed that there were packaged rolls for 50% off on the counter, since it was the end of the day. We got a shrimp tempura roll, sashimi rolls, and California rolls, plus two bottled drinks for $15.99. One of our rolls was a meal and came with a salad and a miso soup too! We got little plastic containers with ginger and wasabi, not the little tiny packages that barely have enough for the rolls. It was a lot of food we got for that money!
author: Sara W.

description:
we decided to try the food here because the prices looked good and the display was really cute... seemed promising. but we've definitely had muchhhhh better Japanese food.
The udon and donburi were quite tasteless...
And portions were pretty small too. I could hardly finish the food because it was so bland.

Ugh. We're definitely not coming back here again. there are plenty of other places in the mall we can go to.
author: Roland R.

description:
My fav is Fried Sushi with Crab Meat aka Hoppin....!!!
You got to eat it while it's still nice and warm and crunchy....
sometimes you get a 50cents coupon for future purchase...
during the day you get a free sample of the fried sushi,
toward end of day...sometimes they offer 50% off all ready made sushi...
the nice lady Yoon...she is really cool....check this place out...you will not be disappointed!!! =P
author: Laimei W.

description:
Teriyaki is ok. I've gotten a couple of different rolls from here as well. First time I ordered the spicy tuna rolls with my salmon teriyaki. Sushi wasn't all that great (didn't taste fresh), but the salmon was pretty darn good.

Second time I tried the Golden Gate roll, and that too didn't taste all too fresh. Also, maybe it's just my lack of experience, but my sushi was on the warm/room-temp side. I'd feel better if it was chilled.
author: Britany L.

description:
They don't have okonomiyaki. I don't blame them though. Who does?!

Pros:
- Miso soup
- Sushi rolls
- Seaweed
- Fast service 

Cons:
- Rice is a bit hard
- If you order too much, you won't finish it
- I tried speaking japanese, they don't understand me
- The mall is too noisy to enjoy good Japanese food

3 stars for Tokyo Express.
author: Michael K.

description:
I'm actually experiencing some self loathing right now for not frequenting this place more when I lived nary a block away. But logistics aside, I have to say I'm quite fond of their rolls, for mall sushi. Sure they're not the biggest or grandest, but the prices are relatively affordable and the fish is fresh. Surprisingly, I actually crave their double salmon rolls since they put so much lemon on the fish, it actually cooks it. I think I might have been a citrus farmer in a past lifetime, so I'm all for excessive amounts of acid. I haven't tried their meals but upon observation, it seems the portions are big and consist of what you'd expect from general Japanese fare. Overall, the food isn't anything to write home about but is pleasantly surprising for what you'd find in a mall. 

Mark one star off for service. There's this one worker bee that's pretty rude but the beauty of mall food is the speed, so no one has to contend on being waited on for long before you get your food and are back terrorizing the sale rack at Gap.
author: Kat C.

description: worst sushi ever, rice is so sticky and cold, fish not fresh, doesnt taste like fish ughh , wont recommend and i will never order from them
author: Rym R.

description: Nice staff members, quick and clean as well as the bargain of the counter sushi when there is too much sushi and not enough customers. 8 tiny CA rolls only cost me $2.74 for dinner!
author: R C.

description: The sashimi here is not bad in my opinion considering this is a mall food court setup, which means I don't need to tip.  The tempura is ok, could be better.
author: H K.

description: This is probably the best mall food I've ever tasted - it's probably just OK by Japanese restaurant standards but after a day of dealing with crowds of shoppers, aggressive sales staff and bargain hunting - it's great to get some tasty treats and just sit down to rest a bit and feed
author: Quartknee K.

description: Ugh. Worst sushi I have ever had. Sure, they're cheap, but it tastes even cheaper. I couldn't believe how turned off I was by their rolls. I ordered the Philadelphia Roll and the Rock N Roll and they were both terrible. Not only was the flavor uninteresting and monotonous, but the texture of the rolls were non-existant. Complete mush, any toothless wonder could have swallowed them whole. This was the first time ever I've actually thrown sushi away. I spent $11 on both and threw away half of it just because I couldn't bring myself to eat anymore of it. I am totally confused as to why this place has 4 stars. Maybe everything else is decent? Their sushi is a nightmare, I'll will not be giving Tokyo Express another try.
author: Katie S.

description: Because this is "mall food" as others have referred to, it never occurred to me to yelp this place, but after seeing "people love us on yelp" displayed on their desk, I agreed! I mean, this isn't comparable to places like Chin's Sushi or Mikuni's as those are upper echelon restaurants, but this place definitely surpasses mall standards! And for the price I'm paying, I don't expect too much out of the food, but boy, the food ain't bad! The tuna and rice is so fresh, and they are consistent. From my experience, getting cheap spicy tuna rolls isn't even worth if but Tokyo Express proves me wrong.
author: Monica D.

description: Awesome spicy tuna roll and tuna sashimi... the way the cut the tuna sashimi- you can peel off little chunks off the grain, and it was tasty tasty.
author: Roni L.

description: Surprise!  Decent hamachi sashimi and very good miso, seaweed soup..yum rice...bad salad..who knew?
author: Bleep S.

description: They have free sushi samples here once in a while! I like ordering the double salmon roll. It's basically a 49er roll (salmon + lemon slices). The quality is surprisingly good for the restaurant being in a food court. If I am hungry (which is often) and at Stonestown (which is not very often) then I pick up a roll here.
author: O K.

description: Good deal for Bento boxes and make sure to order tempura if you like it. For an on the good sushi, it's alright. My friend used to work here and so he seemed pretty chilled there so I was guessing that the boss is laid back. This is where I run to where I want some quick sushi.
author: Vivian L.

description:
The sushi is A-OK...nothing special. Pretty decent for mall sushi.

However, I just love the fact that all the sushi rolls are 50% off after 8pm on weeknights! Mind you, the prices here are already cheap as is. You also get complimentary salad and miso soup (which my daughter loooves) with your order. I come here from time to time after a long day of studying when I'm too tired to cook. Stonestown is only a couple blocks away from my SF home. 

It's really a deal for what you're getting!
author: Angie L.

description:
it's a great deal.
everything is delicious. 
I go here at least once a month.
they are nice and consistent.
seating can sometimes be a problem, it's not their fault.
it's the shit, go.
EXPRESSSSSSSS.
author: Dadasd d.

description:
here's another rave review for food court fare!  (i'm not a mall rat...really, i'm not)  

funny enough, i used to hit up the tokyo express in fidi (on sacramento) quite a bit back in the day, for the lunchtime beef teriyaki/tempura bento combo.  don't know why i stopped, perhaps because i 1. discovered closer japanese joints; and 2. reduced my intake of beef teriyaki at lunch (food comas are not conducive to being productive at work!)

anyway, one day when the line @ panda next door was a bit too long for my impatient and ravenous self, i glanced next door and discovered the japanese place was now a tokyo express - a familiar name!  i then spied free samples - HELLO!  one bite of the deep fried sushi roll (i forget what it's called, it's a special not on the regular menu - flying something or other?  it's like a deep fried california or unatemp roll) and i was hooked.  extensive list of creative (or some might purists might say bastardized sacrilege) sushi rolls, pretty quick service.  tempura don is pretty tasty too; not greasy or overly battered tempura, just perfectly crisp and satisfying.  nice to know i now have a choice of panda, sorabol or tokyo @ stonestown!
author: Jen P.

description: I usually don't go for mall food, but this place is awesome! The prices are cheap and the food is good. I've gotten the tempura udon and the donburi, and they both were pretty good. I can't wait to come back soon.
author: Alex Y.

description:
pretty good  ... spider, calfornia rolls and  the hopper  is hella good... your safe with anything you order.... pretty cheap too 8 pieces for like 5 bucks
good eats!
author: raji b.

description: When I'd visit my sister at work when she worked at the Macy's at this mall, we'd go to eat sushi here on her lunch breaks. For mall food, the food is really good and cheap! Yay for cheap tasties! They've got pre-made rolls and rolls you can order to be made. Make it a combo to get miso soup and salad and you got a very filling meal.
author: Susan Y.

description: Personally, I love Tokyo Express, especially tuesday special: your choice of donburi, salad soup and sushi for $10.  Also love love the hopping california roll.  Food  is good and so is the price.  It is not somewhere I will go out of my way for but if I am at Stonestown, it is the best one in the food court.
author: Eva E.

description:
4 stars for the hopping california rolls. i dont really like their other stuff actually, so i will only eat the hopping california rolls (deep fried california rolls) when i am there. careful when u eat them, sometimes they are really hot inside when the outside shell cools enough to eat it. i like the mix of sweet and spiciness.
and i also like that i can replace the miso soup with another salad if i order the tonkatsu.
service is aight. its pretty inconsistent and sometimes u will get a nice greeting and other times u wonder wtf?
author: Bee B.

description: You know, I think the customer service here has improved over the years by a lot. The food's alright. I just love their shogun sushi roll :)
author: M J.

description: I only review mall food it's good, and Tokyo Express is. I'm still surprised at how much I enjoy the food. I always order the Salmon Teriyaki with Srimp & Vegetable Tempura (which comes with Miso Soup and Salad) and a Green Tea Mango Snapple :) I love the deep-fried spicy tuna rolls they give out as a sample. The other sushi options are great as well. Compared to everything else they have at Stonestown, this place kicks ass.
author: Jen Y.

description: I don't eat sushi, but last time I was in stonestown I stopped by and decided to try their vegetable tempura and it was delicious!  I got the meal that came with rice, salad and soup and it was all under $10.  I really enjoyed the mix of sweet potato, zucchini, broccoli and carrots.  Surprisingly, my favorite was the sweet potato.  Not too fond of miso soup but other than that, I loved it. Friendly people, too!
author: OLGA M.

description: i love japanese food.. and this is the only place that has japanese food in Stonestown Galleria.. food are good. sushi is pre packaged and tastes good and fresh. Love their combo plate which has soup and salad and rice with ur choice of meat..
author: Lily T.

description:
their UDON is sooooooo good! all of them!!
their free miso soup is also good!
Free water!
Free side sald!
any of their items with teriyaki sauce on it is a must!
i like the caterpillar roll the best!
Spider roll delicious!

MHHM MHMM MHHHHHHHHHMMMMMMMM!!! =D
author: Kelly L.

description: Crab shell in your sushi is not the best thing in the whole entire world
author: daniel a.

description: I love this place so much! My favorite dish is the Udon. Sometimes I get chicken udon , sometimes beef and sometimes tempura. It is the best best place to eat at this mall. Forget about Sorabol, Tokyo Express has better chicken teriyaki and the portion is far more generous too!
author: Millie N.

description: No point in going over the same comments of past reviewers until you're done beating a dead horse. This place is my favorite food place at this mall.  The sushi rolls are good and better than the Japanese place it replaced.  They have a counter full of various sushi packaged to go and you get a cup of tea with it.  And if it's one of the specials, it comes with a sm. salad (peppery dressy) and miso soup (not fantastic but good).  Haven't tried the regular entrees but since I only go for their sushi, it doesn't matter.   Have to say the sushi here is even better than some of the ones found at Japanese restaurants in the neighborhood for a reasonable price.  I didn't like their spicy tuna roll and the special of the day, Tempura Donburi was interesting.  It was a big bowl of rice, topped with seaweed, picked daikon, boiled broccoli and a fried egg and then 2 pieces each fried shrimp, carrots, yam and broccoli.  It was rather oily.  Meh.  Stick with the sushi next time.
author: Ry T.

description: if you are a SFSU student, dont have a car and u are pretty much sick and tired of the choices on campus, you have no choice but to hit Stonestown. So, I have pretty much tasted ALL in there, yes I am a professional student , and have been here long enough to have done that. Well, Tokyo Sushi was not on my shit list until yesterday. Before yesterday, I would occasionally enjoy their fried chicken thingy (i think its called lemon chicken) and the occasional pre-packaged warm sushi, but yesterday OMG, me and my gay had the spicy tuna roll. Needless to say that me and my friend looked as if we had just finished our fluffer shift down in the Valley. OK, so you say "well that is not the restaurant's fault, you guys had allergies or something" well, you have a point, but it turns out that we are NOT allergic to shellfish or any type of fish people!!!! we are puzzled.....well,  ok, other than that, i am not too excited about their hygiene in there, their sushi is WARM and that sashimi has been sitting there, under those hypnotic mall lights for who knows how long (TIP:  after 8:30 pm you can go in there and buy "old" sushi for half the price).  Anyway, food is what u expect from a mall, just  DONOT eat the sushi!! raw food and mall just dont go together. Also, are those Mexicans in the kitchen? hey! oye, lavate las manos cochinos! casi nos matan a mi y a mi amigo!
author: Terry R.

description: The meal is a great value when you are in a rush.  I especially like the Chicken Don.  Always satisfied when I order this. The meal comes with a salad and soup.  The sushi could be better buts it's fresh and hey it's a takeout so I don't expect too much.
author: A N.

description: a-ok 3 stars for mall sushi.  expand that category to all sushi, and it's an eekmeh 1.5 stars.
author: Reina M.

description: place is not that bad.  came here with a friend after class.  its kinda pricey, maybe cause im a broke student. not the best place for japanese food, but one of the better places to eat at in the mall, and cause they got a cute girl working there..heh
author: A L.

description: i love their hopping california roll!!! definately try it, and this place has come a long way from when they first opened. their prices aren't too bad either. hopping californai roll--'nuff said!
author: P M.
